_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
A.	 Introduction
Farmers Cooperative Association is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed, and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years.

B.	 Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program
This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state and federal anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire, re-hire employees, also every three years as required by OSHA or when a change to equipment or procedures. The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. The plant was constructed to comply with current industry standards for the storage of pressurized anhydrous ammonia.  CGA G-2.1-2014 is the standard that our facility strives to comply with.

C.	Emergency Response Policies and Programs

Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. This facility has an Emergency Action Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Action Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Action Plan for this facility and invited for a tour

on a regular basis.

D.	Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.  Worst-case scenarios have been shared with the county LEPC in planning for a catastrophic event. 

E.	Five Year Accident History

This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off-site consequences during the entire operation period. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.

F.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Management of this company and facility continuously strives for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Periodic safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions: annual equipment inspections are also conducted.  Farmers Cooperative Association will strive to meet any new published currently accepted industry standards for the storage of pressurized anhydrous ammonia.  The company is also in the process of installing a pipe fence along the entrance of the facility that may be locked during non-operating hours to prevent unauthorized vehicles from entering around the perimeter.

G.	Summary

The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come. Crossland Construction is one of the areas of concern that have been considered as part of the community response plan for this anhydrous ammonia process.
